goal.tools

Class PlatformManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.PlatformManager

  • public class PlatformManager
extends java.lang.Object
    FIXME: This class should not be needed. MASPrograms, GOALPrograms and UnitTests should contain internally references to all their relevant files. Removing this class allows a large amount of static state to be removed from the GOAL core.

    Keeps track of all files and their associated parsed objects by maintaining a static map that contains of file-parsed object pairs. This provides a unique store of file references and their associated parsed objects that can be accessed by other classes that need access to the result of parsing a file.

    The PlatformManager is a utility class that provides functionality mainly for and related to parsing file types recognized by the GOAL platform (@see Extension).

    Since:
    23jul09: PlatformManager extends Observable (see TRAC #696). Inspired by Jade (PlatformController.Listener) the PM sends platformEvent objects to its listeners., 27jul09: PlatformManager merges JADE platform events with DebugObserver platform events (Agent.SLEEPS, etc).
    Author:
    W.Pasman modified 20jul09.

      • getMASFiles

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> getMASFiles(java.io.File fileOrFolder,
                                       boolean recursive)
        If argument is a mas2g file it will be added. If the argument is a folder all mas2g files in it will be added. If recursive is true, mas2g files from all sub-folders (and sub-sub-folders, etc.) will also be added.
        Parameters:
        fileOrFolder - File or folder to load mas2g file(s) from.
        recursive - If true all mas2g files in subfolders will also be loaded.
        Returns:
        List of the MAS files that were loaded.

      • getUnitTestFiles

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> getUnitTestFiles(java.io.File fileOrFolder,
                                            boolean recursive)
        If argument is a test2g file it will be added. If the argument is a folder all test2g files in it will be added. If recursive is true, test2g files from all sub-folders (and sub-sub-folders, etc.) will also be added.
        Parameters:
        fileOrFolder - File or folder to load test2g file(s) from.
        recursive - If true all test2g files in subfolders will also be loaded.
        Returns:
        List of the test2g files that were loaded.

      • parseMASFile

        public MASProgram parseMASFile(java.io.File masFile)
                        throws GOALParseException
        Creates a MAS program from a MAS (.mas2g) file. Loads the file, parses its content, and validates the result.
        Parameters:
        masFile - The the MAS (.mas2g) file.
        Returns:
        The parsed and validated MAS program.
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - If ANTLR stream cannot be opened. If parsing MAS file generates errors.
        java.io.IOException - If file could not be closed properly.

      • parseGOALFile

        public GOALProgram parseGOALFile(java.io.File goalFile,
                        KRlanguage language)
                          throws GOALParseException
        TODO: duplicates most of the code of parseMASFile... Returns a GOAL program that is the result of parsing the agent file.
        Parameters:
        goalFile - The agent file to load.
        language - The KR language that is used in the agent file.
        Returns:
        GOAL program resulting from parsing the agent file.
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading. Or if an ANTLR stream could not be opened. if the parser or lexer encountered errors while parsing the given .goal file. Indicates that the returned value is null or otherwise invalid.

      • getImportedFiles

        public java.util.Set<java.io.File> getImportedFiles(java.io.File agentFile)
        Gets the files representing the child files of the given agent file. A file is a child file if the agent file has an #import < child file > command. This returns only DIRECT children of the file, not children of children.
        Parameters:
        agentFile - The agent file to get the child files of.
        Returns:
        The list of files that are imported by the given agent file. A new list is created every time this method is called.

      • resolveFileReference

        public static java.io.File resolveFileReference(java.lang.String directory,
                                java.lang.String fileReference)
        Tries to resolve a reference to a file.

        Checks whether the reference refers to an existing file (is an absolute path), or else searches for the referenced file relative to the directory that is provided.

        Parameters:
        directory - Reference to the directory where the MAS file can be found that contains the environment reference that needs to be resolved.
        fileReference - A reference to an environment file contained in the MAS file.
        Returns:
        A file if the environment reference was resolved; null otherwise.

      • createfile

        public static java.io.File createfile(java.io.File newFile,
                      Extension extension)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new file and inserts a corresponding template into the file for a given extension. Overwrites already existing file.
        Parameters:
        newFile - The file to be created.
        extension - The Extension the file to be created should have. The extension is also used to select and apply the corresponding template to insert initial content in the file.
        Returns:
        The newly created or emptied file (CHECK which is just the same file as given as first param?).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
